channel.title: Mit on OSRTOS
channel.description: Recent content in Mit on OSRTOS

item.title: MicroPython
item.description: A lean and efficient Python implementation for microcontrollers and constrained systems.

item.title: MOE
item.description: MOE is an event-driven scheduler system for 8/16/32-bit MCUs. MOE means “Minds Of Embedded system”.

item.title: LittlevGL
item.description: LittlevGL is a free and open-source graphics library providing everything you need to create a Graphical User Interface (GUI) on embedded systems with easy-to-use graphical elements, beautiful visual effects and low memory footprint.

item.title: SPIFFS
item.description: Spiffs is a file system intended for SPI NOR flash devices on embedded targets.

item.title: scmRTOS
item.description: scmRTOS is tiny Real-Time Preemptive Operating System intended for use with Single-Chip Microcontrollers. scmRTOS is capable to run on tiny uCs with as small amount of RAM as 512 bytes. The RTOS is written on C++ and supports various platforms.

item.title: BRTOS
item.description: BRTOS is a lightweight preemptive real time operating system designed for low end microcontrollers.

item.title: FreeRTOS
item.description: FreeRTOS is a popular real-time operating system for embedded devices, being ported to 31 microcontrollers. It is distributed under the GPL with an optional exception.
